title: Completion broken for `brew upgrade` on Linux

labels.name: outdated
labels.description: PR was locked due to age

body:
### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Your system is ready to brew.
```


### Verification

- [X] My "`brew doctor` output" above says `Your system is ready to brew.` and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] I ran `brew update` twice and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [X] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 4.2.2
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: 705d2564ddfb9c915ee9425dd9ed408bfac61005
Last commit: 30 hours ago
Core tap JSON: 02 Jan 23:32 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_DISPLAY: :0
HOMEBREW_DISPLAY_INSTALL_TIMES: set
HOMEBREW_EDITOR: vim
HOMEBREW_GITHUB_API_TOKEN: set
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 20
Homebrew Ruby: 3.1.4 => /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/3.1.4/bin/ruby
CPU: 20-core 64-bit unknown_0x6_0x9a
Clang: N/A
Git: 2.34.1 => /bin/git
Curl: 7.81.0 => /bin/curl
Kernel: Linux 5.15.133.1-microsoft-standard-WSL2 x86_64 GNU/Linux
OS: Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS (jammy)
WSL: 2 (Microsoft Store)
Host glibc: 2.35
/usr/bin/gcc: 11.4.0
/usr/bin/ruby: N/A
glibc: N/A
gcc@11: N/A
gcc: N/A
xorg: N/A
```


### What were you trying to do (and why)?

Use tab-completion (in bash) to upgrade a formula without typing its full name (because I'm lazy and/or don't want to misspell it).

### What happened (include all command output)?

```shell
$ brew uninstall libg[Tab] ... completes to:
$ brew uninstall libgit2
```

```shell
$ brew upgrade libg[Tab] ... completes to:
$ brew upgrade libgError: Invalid `--cask` usage: Casks do not work on Linux
â€‹
```

At that point, I seem to still be in the middle of typing the command. <kbd>Enter</kbd> gets me: `Error: No available formula with the name "libg". Did you mean libgr?`

I've also seen the completion work, but with the error (and newline) in the middle of it. But I can't replicate this example:
```shell
$ brew upgrade linu[Tab] ... completes to:
$ brew upgrade linuError: Invalid `--cask` usage: Casks do not work on Linux
x-headers@5.15 
```

### What did you expect to happen?

Formula name should autocomplete without error.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
[Run homebrew on linux]
brew install [formula]
brew upgrade [partial formula name][Tab]
```
